arguments.summary: The name of the call sample within the call VCF. Not required if only one sample exists.
arguments.name: --CALL_SAMPLE

arguments.summary: The VCF containing the call sample
arguments.name: --CALL_VCF

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and GELI).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: Default is false. If true, filter status of sites will be ignored so that we include filtered sites when calculating genotype concordance.
arguments.name: --IGNORE_FILTER_STATUS

arguments.summary: If true, multiple interval lists will be intersected. If false multiple lists will be unioned.
arguments.name: --INTERSECT_INTERVALS

arguments.summary: One or more interval list files that will be used to limit the genotype concordance.  Note - if intervals are specified, the VCF files must be indexed.
arguments.name: --INTERVALS

arguments.summary: When writing SAM files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort a SAM file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: Genotypes below this depth will have genotypes classified as LowDp.
arguments.name: --MIN_DP

arguments.summary: Genotypes below this genotype quality will have genotypes classified as LowGq.
arguments.name: --MIN_GQ

arguments.summary: Default is false, which follows the GA4GH Scheme. If true, missing sites in the truth set will be treated as HOM_REF sites and sites missing in both the truth and call sets will be true negatives. Useful when hom ref sites are left out of the truth set. This flag can only be used with a high confidence interval list.
arguments.name: --MISSING_SITES_HOM_REF

arguments.summary: Basename for the two metrics files that are to be written. Resulting files will be <OUTPUT>.genotype_concordance_summary_metrics and <OUTPUT>.genotype_concordance_detail_metrics.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: If true, output all rows in detailed statistics even when count == 0.  When false only output rows with non-zero counts.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT_ALL_ROWS

arguments.summary: Output a VCF annotated with concordance information.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT_VCF

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: The name of the truth sample within the truth VCF. Not required if only one sample exists.
arguments.name: --TRUTH_SAMPLE

arguments.summary: The VCF containing the truth sample
arguments.name: --TRUTH_VCF

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: If true, use the VCF index, else iterate over the entire VCF.
arguments.name: --USE_VCF_INDEX

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

description:
Calculates the concordance between genotype data for two samples in two different VCFs - one being considered the truth (or reference)
 the other being the call.  The concordance is broken into separate results sections for SNPs and indels.  Summary and detailed statistics
 are reported
name: GenotypeConcordance
